column4: i installed kde for a while, but it switched my login to KDM. I removed kde today and now I have no graphickal login whatsoever! how do I restore it to GDM?
dpkg-reconfigure gdm does not work, and I can't unlock gdmsetup to fix it with that
are you using a "sudo" with the reconfigure? (need to ask to make sure!) Here is a link too: http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/how-to-switch-between-gdm-and-kdm-on-ubuntu/
yes I used sudo
with sudo I do not know why "sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm" is not working.  Is there any output you can pastebin for people here?
no, there is no output
I do not know how to proceed from here.  You had KDE installed and then what?  Recap for everyone else here.. ;)
what if you reinstalled KDE? "sudo apt-get install kuduntu-desktop"?  Would you be willing to try that?
what if you reinstalled KDE? "sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop"?  Would you be willing to try that?
does "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop" pull in something that may be missing?
yes it does: f-spot firefox firefox-branding firefox-gnome-support gdm-guest-session pulseaudio-module-bluetooth pulseaudio-module-gconf ubufox ubuntu-desktop
then try the dpkg-reconfigure gdm once those are installed!  Fingers-crossed! ;)
hmmm...still nothing. I will log in again and try then.
still nothing
sorry, I don't know where to go from here.  Hopefully someone else can help generate some leads..  Post your situation every few minutes till someone bites?
yeah, thanks though!
you're welcome! :)
so you can boot into a GNOME graphical environment? I was assuming you were stuck on a command line.  If so, when you log out what session manager appears?  Can you choose icewm from there?
when i log out it brings me back to CLI
but you do have a graphical gnome desktop?
if you have the desktop then shouldn't there be *some* session manager running, even if it is not GDM?
idk, really. I would assume that it does not /need/ it
brb
I'm not sure either but I was always under the assumption that the session manager bootstrapped the desktop.... idk!
